key_points: Harry and Meghan, the Duke and Duchess of Sussex, visited Task Force Liberty at Joint Base McGuire-Dix-Lakehurst, New Jersey.
They met with Afghan refugees, speaking to women and children who had recently arrived in the United States.
The base is currently home to more than 10,000 Afghan refugees.
The couple interacted with children in daily schooling, participating in a classroom teaching conversational English.
Harry and Meghan engaged with the children, using simple English phrases and learning common terms in Dari.
They led the children in singing 'Head, Shoulders, Knees and Toes,' and shared it's a favorite song of their son, Archie.
They thanked teachers for their efforts and emphasized the importance of self-care and mental health.
SSgt Jake Carter of Task Force Liberty Public Affairs documented the visit.
The visit highlights Harry and Meghan's ongoing mental health advocacy.
Task Force Liberty was initiated coinciding with the withdrawal of American troops from Afghanistan, aimed at supporting Afghan refugees.
